definition: to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)

sentences.english: but as for the esteem of the others, it is a reproach in itself.
sentences.chinese: 但是别人对他的器重，却实在是一种责备。

sentences.english: I have never yet known what it was to separate esteem and love.
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道怎么好把器重和喜爱分离开呢。

sentences.english: He was also highly regarded by the imperial court, and was made an official by edict of the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 当时朝廷也很器重他，皇上封他当了大官。

sentences.english: Even if the boss loves you, things can change.
sentences.chinese: 即使老板很器重你，但一切都可能发生变化。

sentences.english: A stays in the unit very suffer boss regard highly.
sentences.chinese: 阿呆在单位很受老板器重。

sentences.english: Child get acquainted with into the He Dingqing 6 years ago, and get the regard highly of the other side and credit.
sentences.chinese: 子成六年前和丁青结识，并且得到对方的器重和信任。

sentences.english: The teacher thinks highly of him because he does best in every exam.
sentences.chinese: 因为他每次考试都考得最好，所以老师很器重他。

sentences.english: In ancient times, there was a prime minister named Shang Yang in the State of Qin. He was held in high regard by the King.
sentences.chinese: 古时候秦国有个相国叫商鞅，秦王非常器重他。

sentences.english: For a while, Beckham was one of those chosen players.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，贝克汉姆也是这些被器重球员中的一员。

definition: to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
to put in an important position
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
to treat sb favorably/to view in a new light
to love and respect/love and respect
lit. the kindness of recognizing sb's worth and employing him (idiom)/patronage/protection
loyal and devoted (idiom); faithful and true
